stories.text: As of writing, 2^82,589,933 âˆ’ 1 is the largest known prime, but do we know all of the primes lower than it? If not, what is the largest known prime in sequence, without gaps?
stories.title: Ask HN: What is the largest known prime in sequence?

stories.text:
Just tried to login to chase.com using a fresh Firefox install. Normally it gives options for email or SMS for 2FA verification. Since SMS is insecure, I've always used email. That option is now missing. Since SMS was the only option left, I tried that, but it doesn't work with my Google Voice number.

According to customer support, email verification was removed for everyone and they've been getting lots of calls about it. Also according to them carriers often block SMS short codes, which makes SMS more error-prone than email.

Anyone know anyone on at Chase engineering? I would love to hear the rationale for removing something as universal as email while leaving insecure SMS as an option.
stories.title: Chase.com has removed the ability to verify a new device/browser using email

stories.text:
Hello,

There was a post a few months (a year maybe) back about an AI reverse image lookup that turned out to find people who look similar to the photo uploaded.

I've been trying to find the website without any success so I'm asking here if anyone might know.

Thank you!

Edit: It's not tineye and I believe not pimeye (this stuff is premium only, maybe it wasn't before and that's the one idk)
stories.title: Ask HN: Reverse image search that finds people who look like you?
